thread.title: Billy Eppler Leaves Yankees to Become Angels’ General Manager
thread.title_full: Billy Eppler Leaves Yankees to Become Angels’ General Manager - The New York Times

author: Billy Witz
title: Billy Eppler Leaves Yankees to Become Angels’ General Manager
text:
Billy Eppler, the assistant general manager of the Yankees , has been named general manager of the Los Angeles Angels , the team announced Sunday night.
 Nationals Fire Manager Matt Williams OCT. 5, 2015 Innocence Is a Virtue for Young Astros OCT. 4, 2015 2015 M.L.B. Season in Review OCT. 4, 2015 Essay: On a Trip to Fenway, Only the Game Was Meaningless OCT. 2, 2015 Extra Bases: Some Close Calls, but Baseball’s Awards Go to ... OCT. 3, 2015 Orioles 9, Yankees 4: Sputtering Yankees Are Rewarded After a Victory (by Arizona) OCT. 4, 2015 Eppler, 40, who signed a four-year contract, had been with the Yankees for 11 seasons, having previously served as director of pro scouting and director of pro personnel.
He replaces Jerry Dipoto, who resigned July 1 after a series of disagreements with Angels Manager Mike Scioscia and is now the Seattle Mariners’ general manager. The Angels were eliminated from the playoffs Sunday when they lost to the Texas Rangers.
